poem:
Title: "Unyielding Dawn"

Sánchez, like a steadfast mule,
In his harsh garden of politics,
shakes the ripe sun with refusal.
Stones thrown at wisely painted bricks. 

Through media fields and judicial groves
his roots probe deeply, winding
Into adversaries, unkind.
A moment's warning, morning find,
Power like a red wheel barrow,
rolls onward, undeminding.
